English: idiot (calque of hálfviti Is, halfwit NE) (semi- + witi)
to populate (calque of NE, bevölkern NHG) (ga- + þiuda + -jan)
tap water, tapwater (calque of NE) (^tappa + wato)
to improve, better (transative) (causative of batnan, indirectly attested through gabatnan)
to guard, protect, watch over (from *wardōjanan PG)
collection (a physical collection, not the act of collecting) (lisan + -jo)
collection (the act of collecting or a physical collection, although with the latter it is better to use lisjo instead) (causative of lisan + -eins)
luck (From Greek τύχη) Awi (n.ja) luck, fortune (from Proto-Germanic *aujan)
bowl, pot, basin (from *bullōn PG) (basin as a calque of λεκάνη Gr)
mountain range (calque of fjellkjede Nor, mountain chain NE)
limit, boundary (from *mairjan PG) (largely synonymous with marka)
to categorise, categorize, classify (calque of flokka Is)
embrace, adopt (calque of embrace NE, ενστερνίζομαι Gr) (in- + brusts + -jan)
icicle, glacier (from *jikilaz PG) (second meaning from ON and Is)
allude to, insinuate (+ acc., to) (calque of anspielen NHG, anspela Sw, allūdō L) (ana- + ^spilon)
to do without, dispense with, be deprived of (+ gen.)(calque of entbehren NHG) (and- + bairan)
to deprive (someone acc. of something gen.) (causative of ^andbairan)
deprival, dispensal (+ gen., of) (nominalisation of ^andbairan, see baurþs)
deprival, depriving (the act of depriving someone) (^andbarjan + -eins)
to develop (calque of NE, entwickeln NHG) (and- + ^windan)
to wind, wrap (indirectly attested through biwindan)
to rate, grade (school) (calque of werten NHG) (wairþ + -on)
to evaluate, assess (calque of bewerten NHG) (bi- + ^wairþon)
regular (calque of NE, reglulegur Is, regelmäßig NHG) (^garaideins + -leiks)
to analyse, examine (calque of ἀναλύω OGr)
thorough, in-depth (calque of gründlich NHG, grundligt Sw, grondig Du)
to prescribe (calque of verschreiben NHG, praescrībō L)
to oppose, set against (calque of ᾰ̓ντῐτῐ́θημῐ OGr, oppōnō L)
to contrast (+ and, with/against) (extension of meaning based on contrast NE, compare andstæða Is)
attempt, try (nominalisation of ^fairsokjan, see sokns, compare with Versuch NHG)
merry, awake, brisk (indirectly attested through mundrei, compare munter NHG)
to encourage (us- + ^mundrs + -jan) (calque of ermutigen NHG, oppmuntre No)
to further, promote (fruma + -jan) (calque of *framjanan PG, see KG fördern)
in the sense of (calque of im Sinne von NHG, í skilningi Is)
absolute (extension of meaning based on Latin and Greek)
in reference to (calque of Is, NHG, Nor, NE)
an etymology (for a particular word) (calque of orðsifjar Is) (waurd + sibja)
etymology (field of study) (calque of orðsifjafræði Is) (^waurdasibja + -leisei)
combination, compound (nominalisation of ^miþbindan, compare with gabundi) (second meaning also found in Verbindung NHG, samband Is)
-ose (chemical sugar affix) (taken from glaiwkus as in English)
anemia (blodalaus (bloodless), Calque of Greek αναιμα + siukei 'illness')
hemolytic anemia (lit. Sickness of loosening blood)
leukemia (Calque of Greek λευκός 'white' and αιμα 'blood' + siukei)
to fester, to become infected (from Proto-Germanic *sweraną)
to consist (af + dat., of) (calque from cōnsistō L, samanstanda Is)
Pacific Ocean (haf 'ocean' + Pâkifikus, from Latin pācificus)
Oxygen (^sûr + -abni) (calque from Sauerstoff NHG, súrefni Is)
Helium (calquing the sun element from Greek Ἥλιος)
Hydrogen (wato + -abni) (compare with augadauro) (calque from Wasserstoff NHG)
proportion, share, portion (calque from Anteil NHG, Andel Sw)
liquidity, fluidity, liquid, fluid (calque of Flüssigkeit NHG)
function, role (calque of hlutverk Is) (hlauts + gawaurki)
Jinja, Shinto Shrine (from Japanese 神社)
Japanese Cypress, Chamaecyparis obtusa (from Japanese 檜)
quantity (attested, extension of meaning based on Menge NHG)
namely (namo + -leiko) (calque of nämlich NHG, namely NE, nefnilega Is)
to a great extent, largely, to a high degree (du + dails + mikils) (calque of till stor del Sw)
marsh, swamp (from *brōkaz PG, compare bruoh OHG)
canal, cut (from *skurdiz PG, meaning of canal borrowed from skurður Is)
aso., etc, u.s.w. (acronym for jah swa fram)
sect (mitons 'thought' + sxaula 'school', lit. school of thought)
Little Demon, Imp (from Italian diavoletto, French diablotin)
gnome, brownie, tomt, house spirit (gards + ahma)
straight, direct (from *bainaz PG, related to bain) (second meaning found in Icelandic)

vegetable (calque of groente Du, but most Germanic languages call it a green-thing to some extent. In Dutch, groente refers to vegetables in general but in Gothic -iþa refers to an individual plant, like in the word ainiþa)
degree (attested) (from *gridiz PG, related to gradus L)
quality (calque from ποιότης OGr. Cicero calqued the word into Latin too: quālitās)
unique (extension of attested meaning based on ūnicus L)
to be doubtful, to have doubt (tweifl^ + -on; Compare OHG zwīfalōn)
to be anxious (from Proto-Germanic *kwīþanan, Compare Old Norse kvíða)
strong, mighty (seemingly only used in compounds; from Proto-Germanic *ermuna-, compare Old English eormen-, Old Norse jörmun-, and Old High German and Old Saxon irmin-)
Irimsul, the World Tree (airmuna-^ + sauls, calque of Old Saxon Irminsul)
staff, wand, ritual tool (from Proto-Germanic gandaz)
dialect (calque of German Mundart and Dutch mondaard)
university (calque of German Hochschule and Icelandic háskóli)
to condence, to compress, to abbreviate (leitils + jan)
condensation, compression (as in, something that is compressed); abbreviation
condensation (as in liquid on a window or can), compression (the force of compression)
Description (based on Ufarmeli/Meli inscription(or title)/script and Twis- attested on twisstandan)
dis-, des-, in two, in twain, asunder, in pieces, apart, separate (only attested indicating separation from something)
valid (calque of German gültig and Icelandic gildur)
to hint about, to suggest or imply, to insinuate, to give indications as to (calque of Swedish antyda and German andeuten)
multilingual, polyglot (calque of polyglot with -oþs suffix)
century (lit. 'that which is hundredfold') Taihunfalþei (f.N) decade Twailffalþei (f.N) dozen
swelling, boil, tumor (attested word) Krabbagunds malignant tumor
official (calque of Latin officialis) Andbahtjaleiko (adv.) officially
civil servant (fulk 'folk, common people" + andbahts 'servant, official')
Great South River (Brazilian State, calque from Portuguese Rio Grande do Sul [Mikils + ahwa])
Southern China (from Latin Sīnae and Greek Σῖναι [The southern Chinese])
happy, joyous (from fraus 'joy' (cognate with German Froh, attested as a name element) + -leiks)
clear, obvious, distinct, explicit (calque of Swedish tydlig and German deutlich)
unclear, indistinct, inexplicit (calque of Swedish otydlig and German undeutlich)
context (calque of German Zusammenhang and Scandinavian sammenheng)
Gothism (native pagan Gothic religion, a form of IE spirituality) (Guta + -trauains)
Hellenism (native pagan Greek religion, a form of IE spirituality) (Kreka + -trauains)
Proto-Germanic (from fullatojis) (dignified name for Proto-Germanic rather than the calqued usgairmanisk)
main, primary (used as a prefix like aðal- in Icelandic or haupt- in German)
Southwards, to the South (from *sunþran PG) (analogous to *wiþran PG -> wiþra Go whereby *-an PG is not lost)
an item of furniture, furniture (when in the plural) (calque of húsgagn Is)
cupboard, cabinet (from scrīn OHG and skrín ON, ultimately from scrīnium L)
toy (calque from Spielzeug NHG, leketøy Nor)
lower (reconstructed comparative from undarists, compare unter NHG)
transgender (ja adj), calquing trans ufar gender kuni (Norwegian calques gender and sex as kjønn, so kuni seems logical)
epilepsy (following example of other Germanic languages whose native term for the illness was 'falling sickness')

Gothic: Qima us X (X is in the dative)'
*Keina (from kína IS) or *Kiþa (from Russian/Old Turkic) (both m. N)

English: Silesia *Sila Ślęza River [tributaty of the Oder] (m.N) (from a reconstructed Pre-Indo-European hydronym *selan-)
-itis (medical use) [calque of Greek] ex: hairznjaggs encephalitis
Encephalitis is inflammation of the brain and nervous system
Gothic: Hairznjaggs intundnands hairznjis jah miþstandandins sainwagins ist

English: demarcate (formed in the same way as abgrenzen NHG or afmarka Is)

Gothic: bimeljan (calqued from describe and beschreiben) (bi- + meljan)

English: Ethical, Moral (calque of Greek ηθικος [ηθος (custom, habit) + -ικος]) Biutigei Ethics, Morality
to bring forth; to edit (based on OE gebringen)
editor (calque of Latin editor, from edo [I bring forth])
insect (based on German Kerbtier and Old English Ceorfdeor)
Supernova (Calque of Greek υπερκαινοφανής) (ufar + friska- (fresh) + atteihands (appearance))
hemp, cannabis, marijuana From PGmc. *hanapiz, from Scythian *kanaba, possibly influenced by Greek κανναβις
Tobacco (from Arabic طَبَاق‎ (ṭabāq, “a type of medicinal herb”), same as Spanish)
Gaul; France (poetic) (From walhaz [same origin as Gaul in French] + -ja)
Psychopathy (calque of Greek psukhe and pathos + -ei)
spirits, distilled liquor (calque of Latin 'aqua vitae')

Gothic: Sûr Unauksuribauzjahnutseinags (𐍃𐌿𐍂 𐌿𐌽𐌰𐌿𐌺𐍃𐌿𐍂𐌹𐌱𐌰𐌿𐌶𐌾𐌰𐌷𐌽𐌿𐍄𐍃𐌴𐌹𐌽𐌰𐌲𐍃)- Deoxyribonucleic Acid SUH (𐍃𐌿𐌷)

English: Sclerosis (from hardjan "to harden", calque of Greek σκλήρωσις)
Sadism (lit. Sade-like-hood, derived from the Marquis de Sade)
Masochism (from name of Leopold von Sacher-Masoch)
Rabies (calque of Latin rabiēs); rabid (as an adjective)
sexual intercourse (attested word) Galigjan miþ (𐌲𐌰𐌻𐌹𐌲𐌾𐌰𐌽 𐌼𐌹𐌸) to have sex with (backformation from galigri)
War (as evidenced from Spanish guerra) Militodûþs (𐌼𐌹𐌻𐌹𐍄𐍉𐌳𐌿𐌸𐍃) (Professional) Military (from militon "to serve in [a roman style] army)
to conscript, to draft into the military
Navy (calque of Icelandic sjóhar) Luftuwepn (𐌻𐌿𐍆𐍄𐌿𐍅𐌴𐍀𐌽) Air Force (calque of German Luftwaffe)
line, row, series (from Proto-Germanic *radō) Radon (𐍂𐌰𐌳𐍉𐌽) to arrange, to order Tuzradons (𐍄𐌿𐌶𐍂𐌰𐌳𐍉𐌽𐍃) disorder
Saboteur Tuzradon (𐍄𐌿𐌶𐍂𐌰𐌳𐍉𐌽) to disrupt, to sabotage
Nationality Þiudimitons (𐌸𐌹𐌿𐌳𐌹𐌼𐌹𐍄𐍉𐌽𐍃) Nationalism (based on Icelandic þjóðernishyggja)
-ism, thought, suffix marking ideologies, philosophies or religions
Buddha, Siddharta Guatama (from Ancient Greek Βούττα)
Commandant, Major (calque of French commandant, from haiti 'command, order')
Cougar, Puma (calque of English mountain lion)
furious, hostile, wild with anger (from *gramaz PG)
Gael (from Latin Gaithelus, Latinization of Old Irish goidel)
